text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Nick Lewis.

I'm a Network Development
Engineer for AWS Direct Connect.

AWS certainly has a lot
of different services

and a lot of different
use cases for customers,
but Direct Connect is mainly for customers

that probably wanna push a
lot of data in or out of AWS.
Essentially, you're bypassing the internet

to order a direct physical
connection into AWS.
I started in AWS Premium Support,
which is kind of customer facing support,
which is a really interesting role
because you end up working with a lot

of different customers and
seeing how they use AWS.
And now I'm on the networking side.
But even from there, or from here,

your focus is more on coding
or programming or networking

from a operation standpoint,
or deployment or design.

There's a lot of opportunities
to kind of pick and choose

where you wanna ultimately
go and and work towards that.
There's certainly a lot of ownership here,
in that if you have an idea or a vision
of what you want the future to be,
or how your service or team can do better,
it's something that you can deliver on.
You could spend your time working on that
and studying on that,

and moving towards
deploying that solution.

And there's a lot of other
smart people that are around

to support you and help
you deliver on that.

My personal favorite part
about working for AWS
is just that there's so much to learn
on a day to day basis.

I'm never doing the same thing
over and over again, right.

It's exciting to be constantly
learning something new.
(upbeat music)
